refnamediv.refpurpose: Providing streaming I/O writing to files, strings or user code.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: An class providing an I/O writer abstraction that allows generating output that can be stored or passed on to system files, strings allocated in memory (usually via raptor_stringbuffer), system file handles (FILE*) or to a user function.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream
refsect2.para: Raptor I/O Stream class

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_init_func ()
refsect2.para: Handler function for raptor_iostream initialising.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_finish_func ()
refsect2.para: Handler function for raptor_iostream terminating.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_byte_func ()
refsect2.para: Handler function for implementing raptor_iostream_write_byte().

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_bytes_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: int (*raptor_iostream_write_bytes_func) (void *context, const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nmemb);
refsect2.para: Handler function for implementing raptor_iostream_write_bytes().

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_end_func ()
refsect2.para: Handler function for implementing raptor_iostream_write_end().

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_read_bytes_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: int (*raptor_iostream_read_bytes_func) (void *context, void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nmemb);
refsect2.para: Handler function for implementing raptor_iostream_read_bytes().

listitem.simpara: pointer to buffer to read into
number of items read, 0 or < size on EOF, <0 on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_read_eof_func ()
refsect2.para: Handler function for implementing raptor_iostream_read_eof().

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_handler

warning.para: raptor_iostream_handler is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use raptor_iostream_handler2

refsect2.para: I/O stream implementation handler structure.

listitem.simpara: initialisation handler - optional, called at most once
finishing handler - optional, called at most once
write end handler - optional (for writing), called at most once

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_handler2
refsect2.para: I/O stream implementation handler structure.

listitem.simpara: initialisation handler - optional, called at most once (V1)
finishing handler - optional, called at most once (V1)
write end handler - optional (for writing), called at most once (V1)

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_handler2 ()
refsect2.programlisting: raptor_iostream* raptor_new_iostream_from_handler2 (void *user_data, const raptor_iostream_handler2 * const handler2);
refsect2.para: Create a new iostream over a user-defined handler

listitem.simpara: pointer to context information to pass in to calls
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_handler ()

warning.para: raptor_new_iostream_from_handler is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Create a new iostream over a user-defined handler.
deprecated: Use raptor_new_iostream_from_handler2() instead

listitem.simpara: pointer to context information to pass in to calls
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_sink ()
refsect2.para: Create a new read iostream from a sink.

listitem.simpara: new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_filename ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream reading from a filename.

listitem.simpara: Input filename to open and read from
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_file_handle ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream reading from a file_handle.
The handle must already be open for reading. NOTE: This does not fclose the handle when it is finished.

listitem.simpara: Input file_handle to open and read from
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream reading from a string.

listitem.simpara: new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_to_sink ()
refsect2.para: Create a new write iostream to a sink.

listitem.simpara: new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_to_filename ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream writing to a filename.

listitem.simpara: Output filename to open and write to
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_to_file_handle ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream writing to a FILE*.
The handle must already be open for writing. NOTE: This does not fclose the handle when it is finished.

listitem.simpara: new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_new_iostream_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Constructor - create a new iostream writing to a string.
If malloc_handler is null, raptor will allocate it using it's own memory allocator. *string_p is set to NULL on failure (and *length_p to 0 if length_p is not NULL).

listitem.simpara: pointer to location to hold string
pointer to location to hold length of string (or NULL)
pointer to malloc to use to make string (or NULL)
new raptor_iostream object or NULL on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_free_iostream ()
refsect2.para: Destructor - destroy an iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_format_hexadecimal ()
refsect2.para: Write an integer in hexadecimal to the iostream.
Always 0-fills the entire field and writes in uppercase A-F

listitem.simpara: unsigned integer to format as hexadecimal

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_get_bytes_written_count ()

warning.para: raptor_iostream_get_bytes_written_count is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Get the number of bytes written to the iostream.
deprecated: Use raptor_iostream_tell() instead

listitem.simpara: number of bytes written or 0 if none written so far

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_read_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: int raptor_iostream_read_bytes (raptor_iostream *iostr, void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nmemb);
refsect2.para: Read bytes to the iostream.

listitem.simpara: start of buffer to read objects into
number of objects read, 0 or less than nmemb on EOF, <0 on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_read_eof ()
refsect2.para: Check if an read iostream has ended

listitem.simpara: non-0 if EOF (or not a read iostream)

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_tell ()
refsect2.para: Get the offset in the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_byte ()
refsect2.para: Write a byte to the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_bytes ()
refsect2.programlisting: int raptor_iostream_write_bytes (raptor_iostream *iostr, const void *ptr, size_t size, size_t nmemb);
refsect2.para: Write bytes to the iostream.

listitem.simpara: number of objects written or less than nmemb or 0 on failure

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_counted_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: int raptor_iostream_write_counted_string (raptor_iostream *iostr, const void *string, size_t len);
refsect2.para: Write a counted string to the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_decimal ()
refsect2.para: Write an integer in decimal to the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_end ()
refsect2.para: End writing to the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_statement_ntriples ()
refsect2.para: Write a raptor_statement formatted in N-Triples format to a raptor_iostream

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_string ()
refsect2.para: Write a NULL-terminated string to the iostream.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_string_ntriples ()
refsect2.programlisting: int raptor_iostream_write_string_ntriples (raptor_iostream *iostr, unsigned char *string, size_t len, const char delim);
refsect2.para: Write an UTF-8 string using N-Triples escapes to an iostream.

listitem.simpara: Terminating delimiter character for string (such as " or >) or \0 for no escaping.
non-0 on failure such as bad UTF-8 encoding.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_string_python ()
refsect2.programlisting: int raptor_iostream_write_string_python (raptor_iostream *iostr, unsigned char *string, size_t len, const char delim, int flags);
refsect2.para: Write a UTF-8 string using Python-style escapes (N-Triples, Turtle, JSON) to an iostream.

listitem.simpara: Terminating delimiter character for string (such as " or >) or \0 for no escaping.
flags 0=N-Triples mode, 1=Turtle (allow raw UTF-8), 2=Turtle long string (allow raw UTF-8), 3=JSON
non-0 on failure such as bad UTF-8 encoding.

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_string_turtle ()

warning.para: raptor_iostream_write_string_turtle is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Write an UTF-8 string using Turtle "longString" triple quoting to an iostream.
deprecated: use raptor_iostream_write_string_python() instead

refsect2.title: raptor_iostream_write_stringbuffer ()
refsect2.para: Write a stringbuffer to an iostream.
